reviewText: The 3 titles on this disc are: "House on Haunted Hill", "The Bat" and lastly but awesomely "The Last Man on Earth". Also includes a cd; "Scary Sounds of the Night".  All are required Vincent Price movies, especially "The Last Man on Earth"which you will see as inspiration for several movies that followed.Sit back pop some corn and enjoy!
summary: A must for any classic horror buff
Title: N/A

reviewText: This 5 star rating is simply b/c I payed about 4 bucks for these movies and since I enjoy Vincent Price and these are some of my favorites.  The audio quality is like hearing a old record player and the video isn't like they put a lot of work into cleaning it up.  There is a display of the company at the bottom left of the screen for a little bit during movies but I have other movies from this company and its the same thing they always do.  Overall I didn't find these gripes to be a big deal since considering the price.  It also comes with a bonus cd that is just 1 big track but still nice to have.  I highly recommend for fans of classic horror.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Three of the best movies of Vincent Price illustirous career, "House on Haunted Hill", "The Bat", and "Last Man on Earth.  All three movies are superb in all areas which make a movie a classic, in this instance, edge of your seat excitement, mystery, intrugue, dialouge, plot, acting and directing.  Vincent Price brings each of his characters to life as only he can, they say imitation is a sencere from of flattery, well in this case "House on Haunted Hill" was remade and "I am Legend" is a rip-off of "Last Man on Earth".  The only real problem with this collection is it is not digitally remastered, you will see all the imperfections of the film, but if you can get over that hump, these are movies which are timeless and can be enjoyed over and over again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "HOHH" is an old fave of mine.  I had never seen "Bat" nor "Last Man", but enjoyed both.  The DVD is 1-sided.  All movies are B&W.  The logo unfortunately recurs intermittently in the lower right corner throughout each movie.  "HOHH" has a nice clean, clear look.  It does however have a slight audible hum throughout it.  "Last Man" is definitely NOT "digitally remastered" as claimed on the cover, and has some noise, but is very watchable.  "Bat" is pretty clean, but I doubt remastered, with a very slight hum. The chapter menu misnames several chapters, which is confusing.  With proper expectations, not bad for $3.99.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Vincent price movies are still the classic horror films we remember and these will take you back!
summary: A must to add to your collection!
